labels.analysis: The MCP Server "Git Commit Aider" is designed to simplify git commit workflows for developers working with AI-assisted code changes. Its core functionality involves automatically committing staged code changes to a git repository while marking the commits as being made by AI (by appending "(aider)" to the committer name). This tool streamlines the process of tracking AI contributions in a codebase by reducing manual effort in formatting commit messages and identifying AI-assisted changes.
labels.reasoning: The primary label "Development Tools" was chosen because the server's functionality directly enhances the software development workflow, particularly around version control. The secondary label "API Integration" was selected because the tool is likely to integrate with code editors or other development environments via APIs, although this wasn't explicitly mentioned in the description. The custom label "AI Code Tracking" was added to specifically describe the server's unique focus on identifying and managing AI contributions in version control systems.

tools.name: commit_staged
tools.description: Commit staged changes with a specific message, appending "(aider)" to the committer name.

cwd.description: Optional: The working directory for the git command (defaults to the workspace root).

server_info_crawled.name: Git Commit Aider
server_info_crawled.author: @MrOrz/mcp-git-commit-aider
server_info_crawled.overview: Make git commits on behalf of AI to track AI contributions in your codebase. Commit staged changes with custom messages while automatically appending "(aider)" to the committer's name. Easily integrate this tool into your code editor to streamline AI-assisted commit workflows.

tools.name: commit_staged
tools.description: Commit staged changes with a specific message, appending "(aider)" to the committer name.

cwd.description: Optional: The working directory for the git command (defaults to the workspace root).

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@MrOrz/mcp-git-commit-aider/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())
